Reviews.Title: “very close to the old city, but not very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: Costin M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the old city, but also close to the Sirkeci Train Station, which makes a little bit noise in the rooms. The price is a little high comparable to the service.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Jjaymoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Istanbul. You can walk to most famous attraction or catch a tram is close proximity. This is a basic hotel, it does not have lux to hang around it all day. The general staff is very friendly and helpful to tell you where you can go shopping. But, you must always apply your own checks and balances. The kitchen staff was not so friendly and I was made to pay extra for requesting "Black Tea". Breakfast food runs out quickly if you arrive late. At the time that I was there, the was construction at the train station nearby. Noise level was a bit high but I can expect that once it is completed, it will be low. The only downsideuse to explore other

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of my Geckos Tour. My first impressions were not great. I had arrived at about 11:30am and waited for my room. I understood that check-in time was later than that so was not perturbed by this however I realised quite a few of my tour group also arrived in after me and started getting their rooms. I asked if my room was ready after 15 minutes and they let me put my bag in the room but the room was dirty. Was told to wait for another 10. After waiting 15, was told to wait another 5. After 45 minutes of waiting from the time I arrived, I finally got my room. Asked if they could give me another room when I left my bag in their and told my room was apparently 'lost'. To add insult to injury, my room key was also 'lost'. That meant every time I wanted to go in my room, someone had to escort me and open the door with master key. The room itself was okay, was not expecting much as it was a budget hotel, it had a double bed and small bathroom with a tiny bathtub over shower. Breakfast was okay and had a small selection. There were scrambled eggs available. Was not expecting much and didn't get much. I'm sure there are better hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Best view hands down”
Reviews.Author: Handywoman9
Reviews.Content: Hotel seriously needs renovation, but the view of the Bosphorus from our room was out of this world. Price was too high for the condition, but add a perfect location to the view, and it was hard to complain. Breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, poor!”
Reviews.Author: 494Henry_s
Reviews.Content: Could be nice, but unless you are not a hardcore techno freak and not used to volumes above 130 db as well, you better stay away. Some sort of ventilation system is running in the backyard night and day which frequently reaches the volume of an auger drill. And believe me at 5 am it feels as an airplane is landing right over your head.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C”
Reviews.Author: Shell_1076
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Askoc - it is dirty, old, and has no Air Conditioning. It is too expensive for what it offers, there are much better hotels for cheaper in Istanbul. The construction outside seems to be going on forever, making it impossible for taxis to drop and pick you up at the door. The staff is constantly looking for a way to make more money off you. They told me an airport transfer would be 50 TL, but when I asked around at other places I was quoted 25 TL. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Rita C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights . Convenient location within walking distance of many of Istanbul's tourist attractions - Blue Mosque ,Grand Bazaar , Basilica Cisterns Staff were welcoming and efficient .Excellent buffet breakfast . Would not hesitate to recommend to others looking for accommodation in this price range.Transfers from & back to airport arranged by hotel

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation...”
Reviews.Author: SuyoungKim
Reviews.Content: I went to stay there with a friend who was already staying there. The hotel looked nice in the website and outside but inside is really old and depressing. It's overlooking train station (plus huge construction site at the moment) and there's nothing in the rooftop terrace although they have nice view. There were some nice staff but the service wasn't great either. It's rather full of big group tourists and breakfast seem to run out so early!

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay at Askoc”
Reviews.Author: Bunikul
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at Askoc Hotel and my experience wasn't great. Before booking I read a few reviews and a lot of them were not great, and now I understand why. 1) Hotel Location - it is in a very convenient location, very close to public Tram and a ferry which is handy if you wish to travel to the Asian side. Also it is just 15min walk to blue mosque, which is in the touristic area of Sultanahmet. A lot of restaurants, bars, souvenirs shop, sweet shops are there. Downside: The hotel entrance is just outside a train station where they are also building the new train extension tunnel which will link European side to Asian side. The surroundings are not great; as soonas it rains, there will be mud and pools of water up to the entrance. Not a nice view. I stayed in room 307. 2) The room was booked with internet included, well, from 5 days I stayed, I only had access to internet fro 3 days and event then at random times. They told me that they have a lot of issues with their provider and therefore it happens a lot. The solution they gave me is to use their lounge PC for which you will need to pay 2 TL for 30 min. 3) Service was just a disgrace; impolite and unfriendly staff. Not very helpful and are just seeking to find ways of charging you for things. 4) Room and cleanliness - Room was OK for size and decor. Not much to expect. However, the furniture was old, the beds were uncomfortable, toilet/bathroom was dirt and outdated, needs some refurbishment. The room was not hoovered and the dust never wiped off for my whole stay. They did change towels everyday. 5) Breakfast - Very poor selection of food and not very appetising. The only good thing they had were small pieces of ''cheese bread'' and cheese plates. Nothing else. My recommendation would be to search for other hotels in the area, as i could see that there are a lot of them.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Katique
Reviews.Content: the hotel was ok. The location is good. It's close to the touristic attractions and almost next to a tram station. Terrible sleep quality though. We had a room windows facing the train station, so it was really loud. But being a tourist you are too tired to notice these things. So i'd say it's ok for this money.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe the fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: JanetW49
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful (sorted out our lost suitcase keys!). We were lucky to have a sixth floor room with amazing views - it was difficult to leave the room for our sightseeing! Breakfast was a bit bleak for English tastes but as we were the only English guests we shouldn't complain and takeaways around the city are great value and great taste - try the fish on the waterfront. There's a great little restaurant just around the corner which does the local speciality of a stew in a sealed pot and the welcome was the best ever. We took public transport - easy - from the airport but got a taqxi back as we had a very early flight

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: mikivoyageur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice and the best thing is actually the excellent location... I will never forget the wonderfull views we had from the roomÂ´s balcony (The Bosphorus, Galata Tower, The romantic train Station of the Orient Express, where we also ejoyed a wonderful concert of Armenian and Turkish folk music and the dervices turning... AH!)!!! The rooms are quite spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Amalyaa
Reviews.Content: First of all,they should seriously think about updating their webpage because the photos shown there are VERY FAR from the reality! Furniture is old,walls in the room and hallway are spotted,bathroom looked very unclean (and probably was).I even had serius doubts about going into the shower/bathtube-whatever that was. Lucky me i had to stay there just 1 night so I can't say too much about the hotel staff for this reason. We skipped the breakfast as well,as we thought we won't miss anything judging by the overall quality. Funny part is that the reception area looks really nice and new-you would never guess the mess the hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwi082
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on two occasions, once in April and again in May both for four nights. We enjoyed our stays and found all of the staff from front counter through the dining room and housekeeping staff very helpful and friendly. Our room was always clean and fresh. We travel extensively and this hotel ranks up with any others. The views are good and it is so handy to the Bosphorus, the Asian shore and Sultanhamet. An excellent place to stay and we not only would stay there again but as we enjoyed Turkey so much and plan to return next year we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: aeronaut
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci- area where Askoc hotel is located is not an upscale area- but not really a bad place to stay- you are within reach of everything by foot. I 5 min. you can be on tram to either ferryterminal, Taksim or Hagia Sofya- unless you like to walk. Restaurants, kiosks, supermarkets, baklava bakeries etc. just around the corner. Askoc hotel is located behind the Gar- Trainstation- the street it not dodgy or bad- backstreets does look like that in Turkey, holes, garbage and wild cats and dogs. Garbage is emptied daily and holes repaired once in a while, streetlights are there in evening. But yes, trainstations does tend to attract the more doubtful types- but they are not in front the Askoc. Transfer: You need to know one thing when going to Turkey- timetables etc. are not important to Turks- mainfocus is that you will get there. 15 mins. delays on pick-up is not considered bad and does not need an excuse. Always be in good time when going anywhere- and use the waitingtime wisely. In Turkish terms Askoc hotel is in fact a 4star hotel- some rooms are very small, some noisy and they do not contain the newest designer furniture. They are kept clean, good selection of sattelite channels, and if anything is missing go ask for it. Do you get a bad room, go to reception and ask for a new one- with a smile!! I was in a bad room first night, asked for a new room next day and got it without problems. Yes, sometimes lifts are out of order, and it might not be repaired at once- but eventually it will. Take the other one. Staff- I found everyone to be very kind and helpful- try a few words like hello or thanks in Turkish and you will experience a diffrence. Turks are very interested in you, your language, your country etc. But not if you just show up with attitude as you are superior to them- Turks are very sensitive to this matter. When you travel to Turkey- be prepared, buy a map and know what you want to see- many locals (and some hotelstaff) does not always know everything- thats the way it is, like it or not. Mostly they will not admit they dont know but starts a longer lecture for you- just nodd your head and say thanks and start searching....*hahaha*. If you start complaning about that you will be ignored- Turks are proud people and do not want to know about their ineffencies- they live with it, and you have to accept it while beeing there. But showing respect to them make them do whatever they can to help you- and that can sometimes include the whole family. Just remember that. Food: Normal breakfast is white bread, olives, cucumber or tomatoe, a kind of spread cheese- coffee or tea- The Askoc has many other things to offer- so no complaints really. Continental, English or american breakfast you will get at the conrad, hilton, interconti etcetc. Local hotels are not for everyone- they are local, turkish and wth the serivice which comes with it. some 3 star hotels might be better than some 4 star hotels- but the Askoc does deserve its 4 turkish stars. You might consider to book a chain-hotel if you have specifics, because you can not expect it in a local hotel. Istanbul is worth millions of visits- I can not get enough of it- I love The Turks, their hospitality, helpfulness, kindness, the food etc.. The city contains many treasures- and not only the must sees for the first visit. Go explore and enjoy it- Istanbul is old, new, posh, kitch, modern, stinky, kaotic, not well planned, exotic, fun and ever so beautiful- just dont expect it to be like everywhere else- Istanbul is Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: jetter21
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights during January of 2009 and I would not recommend it to anyone. It had one of the smallest bathrooms I have ever seen in a hotel and the room itself was very tight. It was not very clean and there was a moldy smell throughout my stay. One of the elevator buttons did not work on my floor and I had to wait for quite some time to get on. The staff was rather indifferent and very slow to respond to any request. Overall not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dumid
Reviews.Content: Great city, good location in terms of nearest points of interest, because the hotel is on very small street behind the railway station. We have changed the room 3 times, until we got one that was a little bit more convenient (at least we had a nice view over the Bosphorus). The rooms were small, the airconditioning was loud and not working at all (it was just like a ventilator), the bathroom poor, the soap and shampoo of very doubtful quality, very very poor breakfast (olives, tea, bread, tomatoes, some cheese and eggs), the carpet was dirty , overall the hotel needed a paint inside and outside. Do not reccomend. Great city to come back, but definetely in a hotel that belongs to an international chain.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, un happy staff !”
Reviews.Author: Honesttraveller8
Reviews.Content: Was completly awed by the scenery, the sea, the parks, buildings, etc',etc. Just a real pity in the week we were there we seldom encountered a friendly smile or kind word from the local population especially the hotel staff. What a grumpy lot. We tried to be nice so many times but soon realised just to get on with it, what a pity. Truly a beautiful country, perfect climate. Could have spent a month there despite the constant rip off prices and aggressive behaviour. WOULD go back again but never to the Askoc Hotel with it's general run down look ,(inside) and terrible breakfast menu, UGH. By the way, I'm an easy going individual and am easily pleased especially on holidays, but !! Could live forever on the Princess Islands, a must if you visit.

Reviews.Title: “horrible-dont do it!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hande969
Reviews.Content: Staff was very rude. AC didnt work. requested non smoker room, however room smelled like smoke. Even though we had a baby and I stressed the importance of a quiet room we were placed next to the elevator. AC was loud and didnt cool the room. Room was very humid.we paid for the shuttle service to the airport and the shuttle arrived 20 MINUTES LATE!!!!I had to stress that to the personnel that it is 3am in the morning and to call me cap if the shuttle wouldnt show up. The acted very phlegmatic about this.Didnt seem to care...Anyways...I would never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An ANOMALY”
Reviews.Author: UKenigma
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at its best about in the 1970's. The building is elegant, all marble, a dangerous unlit staircase. Unfortunately to get to it you have to pass piles of rotting rubbish, fly tipping, sofas, etc an unmade up road that gets full of puddles in the potholes. The staff are surly. The airconditioning is so noisy or doesn't work. If you have a back room you have a view of the air conditioning plant for two hotels roaring away all night if you sleep with the window open to try and get some air in, so noisy. . Upstairs on the very top roof terrace there is a great view of the Bosphorous . If you stay ask for a front room on an upper floor with the river view. Further down on the lower floors you just see the station. Its well located for the blue Mosque and for the station and ferry terminals.

Reviews.Title: “what a shocker”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmina
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for 5 nights in a suite room.it was not a suite.2 bedrooms no sitting area nothing.yes the view is nice once you look over the railway lines and station.on arrival staff DEMANDED 45 euros for transfers.we only had pounds and dollars on us so after 5 minutes they said pay when you leave.the next morning as we were leaving to get to a bank the same issue occured.the room was old and tired with paint peeling off the walls and roof.the mould in the bathroom was an eye opener.i know it is cheap so you can not expect the world but the room we got was a disgrace whether it is as they claim a 4 star or a 1 star.it is not a 4 star hotel.we checked out and found a great hotel around the corner for the same price.i will from now on read the reviews more carefully of other travellers. buyer beware with this dark and dreadful hotel which is to mean to even turn lights on when its dark!!!!truly a dreadful stay which front desk could not have given a care about in our experience there

Reviews.Title: “A true disappointment”
Reviews.Author: LKMJH
Reviews.Content: This is suposed to be a 4 star hotel but it is clearly not.: - Unpleasant staff (don't even say hello) - Uncleaned sheets (hair found in the bed) - Dark room and toilets - Breakfast food was not fresh - If you get there at night, they are trying to save so much money that the lobby isn't even illuminated We clearly won't be back..

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: emmab80
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews we were worried about what to expect from the Askoc hotel, therefore before arriving we asked by e-mail to have a room on one of the upper floors with a view of the Bosphorous. When we arrived our room was lovely (adequate size and compact but individual bathroom) with an amazing view and a balcony! The staff were always friendly and helpful. Location is excellent for walking to the main tourist sights. Couldn't of asked for more from this hotel. Would definately stay again if in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “No way this is a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: tottihead
Reviews.Content: I knew it was too good to be true. Such a cheap "suite" in a 4 star hotel. I'm not sure if all the hotels in Turkey are like this but these were by far the smallest rooms I've ever seen. The hotel looks nice from the outside, but is pretty old and outdated in the inside. However, breakfast was not bad, service was good enough, and internet in the lounge was decent. Also, great location. Overall not bad, but DO NOT have high expectations. I guess you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “3 Star not 4”
Reviews.Author: AndyT1975
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with a lot of the more negative comments with regards to the Askoc. The room was very small, smaller than you would expect from a so called 4 star. The guys at reception did vary, but on the whole had a "can't be bothered to make eye contect/speak/ smile etc.." attitude. A smaller chap was friendlier than the other 2 men at the desk. Breakfast was OK and there was a choice of food stuffs. The rooms do have an air ventilation system but it is not aircon as it has to struggle on the lowest temp of about 5c to make the slightest of difference to the room temp when it was 30 odd degrees outside. The same so called "air con" also started dripping on my 2nd and 3rd nights. The hotel website is very misleading as there is no terrace restaurant as shown. There is a roof top terrace which was at first locked and then found to feature a few garden style chairs. I think the problem with the hotel is that it is neither quant such as converted Ottaman properties in Sultanhamet or a luxurious true 4 or 5 star, There are much better places I am afraid. I did initially try to get back at the Alp Guesthouse, that really does have a great roof top terrace. 3 stars from me for this one.

Reviews.Title: “I do recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: motasemq
Reviews.Content: excellent place, very nice view to the see, clean, quit, little bit small room but still good for couples, good breakfast, very helpful staff, secure, close to the most tourist places, price is n... I do recommend the hotel as especially for couples...

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recall a worse hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Tawanaanna
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying in a clean, pretty looking, friendly FOUR STAR hotel in Istanbul. The travel agent also assured us that our request of a double room on the fifth or six floor with view on the Bosphorus, with bathtub, and an in-tact air conditioner was confirmed by the hotel. We arrived, were received by a grumpy reception, led to the 2nd floor, into a twin room, with a dirty bathtub which, however, had no plug. The air conditioning device was in fact working, however, which such noise, that even my husband who usually has no trouble sleeping anywhere, was bothered. When we asked for a double room on the 5th or 6th floor, as promised, we were told: "We are fully booked. There is a double room on the first floor, if you want to change." We declined. Also, as another reviewer wrote, there is no rooftop restaurant, although the photo of it was indeed stunning on the webpage, and I was looking forward to it before reading aforementioned review! The breakfast is mediocre; what bothered me most was that the bread was stale, which I thought was an insult to the country's extremely high bakery standards. Anyway, we felt uncomfortable staying in this hotel, and do not credit it with a FOUR star rating. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taghi
Reviews.Content: Terrible is the suitable word that could suite the whole problems I have passed through with my family during my stay in this terrible hotel. If there is worse word I will use it without hesitation. Reception people are typical of rude and impolite. If they mentioned any where in the websites, that there hotel has air-condition, total lie. I was frustrated, fumed and upset with total reception we got in this hotel. 4 stars hotel in turkey means one star in London. Be careful when you book your holiday in Istanbul especially with such rubbish hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: jammy100000
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul in July. Such a beutiful and magnificent city! the hotel Askoc was clean, basic and above average , better than the second hotel(Best Western Obelisk) I stayed in on my break. It had a beutiful view from the roof but the photos of the hotel can be misleading as no restaurant on the roof. We go on to the roof to find broken chairs and dirt and deluge but a terrific view. If you're booking the Askoc because of the terraced reataurant -don't becauase there is none!! overall, fairly good hotel and good value for money. hotel receptioninsts can be a bit rude but be sure to give them a slight tip to keep them happy. bathrooms O.K ish and would like to go to the same hotel in the future. P.S huge high walls in front of the hotel may look grand in photos but has a tube/train station directly in front. top floor rooms will have a good view of the mosques and landscape though. P.P.S beware of the taxis-will charge high prices and may trick you. better to travel on foot to places.

Reviews.Title: “Two-star station hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beamy
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel as 2 star instead of 4 star as it rates itself. The services are nowhere near 4 star. Most of rooms are size of matchboxes, smell of tobacco smoke and are overlooking the old building roofs. Bathtubs in standard rooms are tiny. If you want a slightly more spaceous room with a seaview you will have to pay quite a lot of extra money (and will get no receipt for it - the staff would not charge anything to your room or card - cash only). The choice for breakfast is so poor that I can not even compare it to a basic Turkish 3-star or a European 2 star or a students' hostel. The soundproofing is non-existent between the rooms, so you will hear every word and sound from the neighbours toilet and bedroom. The bathroom standards choice is very poor - you will get a small bar of soap and a bottle of shampoo (can't guarantee it has not been used before u checked in - as it happened to me). Don't expect hoovering done in the room - there is not such a device in housekeeping possession. The nice views from the top floors or terrace are not enough to make this hotel worth staying in. There are plenty of better hotels in this area.

HotelInfo.Name: Askoc Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 15 Istasyon Arka Sk. Sirkeci | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34420, Turkey
